statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Sam Hunt scored 20 points, Eliel Gonzalez added 19 and North Carolina A&T got its first Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference win of the season with a 68-63 upset of first-place North Carolina Central
article.headline: North Carolina A&T slips past NC Central 68-63.
article.linkText: North Carolina A&T slips past NC Central 68-63.
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Sam Hunt scored 20 points, Eliel Gonzalez added 19 and North Carolina A&T got its first Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference win of the season with a 68-63 upset of first-place North Carolina Central on Thursday night. The Aggies (3-28, 1-15) trailed most of the game but stayed close, getting a layup from Davaris McGowens late in the second half to cut the deficit to four and spark an 11-0 run that put the Aggies on top 64-59 with just fewer than two minutes to play. Del'vin Dickerson hit a 3-pointer at the other end but North Carolina A&T hung on, getting two more buckets from Gonzalez down the stretch to seal it. NC Central (22-8, 13-3) made 6 of 30 shots, including 2 of 14 from 3-point range, in the second half. Patrick Cole had 14 points, Pablo Rivas scored 11 and Dajuan Graf had nine points with 10 assists for the Eagles, who finished the regular season in first place despite the loss.
